articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli military on Monday renewed its calls for mass evacuations from the southern town of Khan Younis, where tens of thousands of displaced Palestinians have sought refuge in recent weeks, as it widened its ground offensive and bombarded targets across the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Israel orders mass evacuations as it widens offensive; Palestinians are running out of places to go

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER AND LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As a cease-fire ticked down last week and Israel prepared to resume its round-the-clock airstrikes, Sen. Bernie Sanders and a robust group of Democratic senators had a message for their president: They were done “asking nicely” for Israel to do more to reduce civilian casualties in Gaza.
articles.title: Biden's allies in Senate demand that Israel limit civilian deaths in Gaza as Congress debates US aid

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Ballistic missiles fired by Yemen's Houthi rebels struck three commercial ships Sunday in the Red Sea, while a U.S. warship shot down three drones in self-defense during the hourslong assault, the U.S.
articles.title: 3 commercial ships hit by missiles in Houthi attack in Red Sea, US warship downs 3 drones

articles.author: JOSHUA GOODMAN and ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — A former American diplomat who served as U.S. ambassador to Bolivia has been arrested in a long-running FBI counterintelligence investigation, accused of secretly serving as an agent of Cuba’s government, The Associated Press has learned.
articles.title: Former US ambassador arrested in Florida, accused of serving as an agent of Cuba, AP source says

articles.author: MICHAEL REZENDES and JASON DEAREN
articles.description: HAILEY, Idaho (AP) — Paul Rytting listened as a woman, voice quavering, told him her story. When she was a child, her father, a former bishop in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, had routinely slipped into bed with her while he was aroused, she said.
articles.title: Recordings show how the Mormon church protects itself from child sex abuse claims

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court is hearing arguments over a nationwide settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma that would shield members of the Sackler family who own the company from civil lawsuits over the toll of opioids.
articles.title: OxyContin maker bankruptcy deal goes before the Supreme Court on Monday, with billions at stake

articles.author: MARY KATHERINE WILDEMAN and MICHAEL PHILLIS
articles.description: At least 1,300 employees of organizations representing fossil fuel interests registered to attend this year's United Nations climate talks in Dubai, more than three times the number found in an Associated Press analysis of last year's talks, as new rules took effect requiring attendees to disclose their employment.
articles.title: At UN climate talks, fossil fuel interests have hundreds of employees on hand

articles.author: KELVIN CHAN
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Hailed as a world first, European Union artificial intelligence rules are facing a make-or-break moment as negotiators try to hammer out the final details this week — talks complicated by the sudden rise of generative AI that produces human-like work.
articles.title: Europe's world-leading artificial intelligence rules are facing a do-or-die moment

articles.author: KANIS LEUNG
articles.description: HONG KONG (AP) — One of Hong Kong’s best-known pro-democracy activists who moved to Canada to pursue her studies said she would not return to the city to meet her bail conditions, becoming the latest politician to flee Hong Kong under Beijing's crackdown on dissidents.
articles.title: Hong Kong pro-democracy activist Agnes Chow jumps bail and moves to Canada

articles.author: BERNARD McGHEE
articles.description: From a hot dog vendor to head of the formidable mercenary army Wagner Group, his rise through Russian society could easily be described as meteoric.
articles.title: Final goodbye: Recalling influential people who died in 2023
